column2:
"Black and White.
Harukotan is composed of these two sides of the same coin - one cannot exist without the other."

"The two sides have long been engaged in a seemingly endless war,
yet none could recall why they fought."

"Alas, there came the day where the White and Black kings,
exhausted from the neverending strife, sought peace between themselves."

"As a symbol to their laying down of arms,
the daughter of the White king and the son of the Black king were to be wed.
With that, peace was granted unto the lands."

"The child born from the union was a peculiar one.
She was of neither White nor Black, but of Gray, and possesed a tiny frame which does not grow."

"The White king blamed the Black son,
and the Black king the white daughter
...And so, the fragile peace was shattered."

"The very symbols of the union sought each other's lives in the war,
a war in which the Ashen child seeks to end."

"And so, she gave her life
in a desperate attempt at quelling their anger."

"The couple regained their sanity,
and having realized the horrors of their actions, made a wish.
A wish to give up their lives in return for the Ashen child."

"The Ashen child wept.
She wept for her parents, who became naught but ashes.
She wept even as the tears flowed from her cusped palms."

"And from those tears a river was formed.
The River of Eternal Tears, which flowed betwixt the Black and the White."

"So did the war end
by the tears of the Ashen child."

"So does the Ashen child pray.
For the fallacy and sacrifice of her parents.
In the hopes that such tragedies will never be repeated."
